title: Mario Balotelli earns THIRD red card this season but Nice beat Lorient and close in on Ligue 1 leaders Monaco
text:
Sport Mario Balotelli earns THIRD red card this season but Nice beat Lorient and close in on Ligue 1 leaders Monaco The Italian showed dissent following a challenge with Zargo Toure but Les Aiglons held on for the 1-0 win Share Mario Balotelli was shown a red card for a third time this season (Photo: AFP)   
Mario Balotelli earned his third red card of the season for Nice in a bizarre circumstances against Lorient. 
The Italian's dismissal did not cost Les Aiglons though, with Wylan Cyprien's goal securing the 1-0 win to close the gap to three points on Ligue 1 leaders Monaco. 
The former Manchester City striker was involved in a physical battle with Zargo Toure and appeared to snap after being grappled in an aerial challenge. 
The No.9 was seen staring towards referee Tony Chapron before a red card was brandished to underline his ongoing discipline problem. Referee Tony Chapron shows Balotelli a red card (Photo: AFP) 
Manager Lucien Favre displayed a baffled look from the sidelines, while Cyprien and Paul Baysse protested with the referee. 
Many appeared equally confused by the dismissal but the former Liverpool star will now miss a crucial period of the season as Nice attempt to stay in touch in the title race. poll loading Does Mario Balotelli receive a hard time from referees? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
